result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

Register as sex offender.

Follow through with sex offender assessment or therapy.

Follow through with recommended aftercare.

Shirlene Perrin
Written Complaint filed by Christopher Cleaves (def) - sent up to Br 2
Status conference on June 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.

10:30 am Def in court w/ Atty Andrew I. Martinez.  Def in custody.  Susan Bakken-Donskey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Martinez:  Mr. Cleaves is asking for a change in counsel.  I've contacted the PD's Ofc.  COURT:  This would be his third attorney?  Martinez states he's the second attorney.
COURT:  Mr. Cleaves, I saw your letter.  Mr. Martinez was just appointed.  It was set for trial and then a plea.  Mr. Cleaves, what I can tell you is that going through multiple attorneys just because you disagree with what they are telling you, they're telling you that for a reason.  The PD's Ofc will not continue to appoint.  Cleaves states this is his life.   COURT:  Changing attorneys is not going to change that.  You're going to be delayed again.  Possibly for years.  They're asking for 10 years.  I have a life out there.  COURT:  If you don't agree with that, set it for trial.  Today, I'll just set it for trial.  Cleaves states he's still waiting for motions.   There are some discoveries I still haven't gotten.  Martinez is familiar with the motions that Mr. Zachar has filed.  We then set it for a plea.
COURT:  Sit down and talk to Mr. Martinez today.  If you still want a different attorney, I'll do that.  I'll tell you that I won't do it again.  Cleaves and Court continues with discussions.  Martinez has no issues with Mr. Cleaves.  Cleaves doesn't have any problem with Mr. Martinez.  This is my live and I just have to fight.  I don't understand why you want me to take a 10 year plea....  You don't have the best interest for me in this case and I'd just like you to resign.  Donskey no obj. to another attorney.  Based on Mr. Cleaves comments today, I dont' think that having another attorney will revolves those.
COURT will allow Mr. Martinez to withdraw.  The PD's Of. will re-appoint.  I will not appoint another attorney again.
STATUS in about 4 weeks.   My goal is to have this set for trial in October.  Bond to continue.
